Claim: Government of India recommends homeopathy and other alternative medicines for preventing coronavirus.
Explaination: THe World Health Organization has stated that there are no proved preventions and treatments for this virus. The mechanisms mentioned by the AYUSH ministry are not scientifically proven to help in tackling coronaviruses.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Government of India recommends homeopathy and other alternative medicines for preventing coronavirus.

Explanation:THe World Health Organization has stated that there are no proved preventions and treatments for this virus. The mechanisms mentioned by the AYUSH ministry are not scientifically proven to help in tackling coronaviruses.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/ayush-ministrys-coronavirus-prevention-notification-raises-eyebrows-6728

Claim: Romania developed a coronavirus vaccine able to cure white people only.
Explaination: There is no known cure for the coronavirus. This is a hoax.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Romania developed a coronavirus vaccine able to cure white people only.

Explanation:There is no known cure for the coronavirus. This is a hoax.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471563-fake-news-romania-has-not-developed-coronavirus-vaccine-able-to-cure-white-people-only.html

Claim: Novel coronavirus can be eliminated by drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar.
Explaination: At present, there is no study or evidence to support the claim.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Novel coronavirus can be eliminated by drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar.

Explanation:At present, there is no study or evidence to support the claim.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-gargling-with-warm-salt-water-can-t-save-you-from-coronavirus-1656600-2020-03-17

Claim: Pictures of people stranded on hospital beds claimed to be Italians not coping with the pressures of COVID-19 cases; India should learn from Italy’s mistakes and not step out of the house in the 21-day lockdown
Explaination: The images were from the earthquake that hit Croatia on March 22, 2020 and were falsely shared as Italy.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pictures of people stranded on hospital beds claimed to be Italians not coping with the pressures of COVID-19 cases; India should learn from Italy’s mistakes and not step out of the house in the 21-day lockdown

Explanation:The images were from the earthquake that hit Croatia on March 22, 2020 and were falsely shared as Italy.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/croatia-earthquake-pics-peddled-as-italy-overwhelmed-with-covid-19-patients-7363

Claim: A video says weed kills coronavirus.
Explaination: The news clip was created through a meme generator while the WHO has stated that there are no proven cures for the virus yet.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video says weed kills coronavirus.

Explanation:The news clip was created through a meme generator while the WHO has stated that there are no proven cures for the virus yet.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/marijuana-kills-coronavirus-meme-viral-with-false-claims-6831?infinitescroll=1

Claim: If you can hold your breath for more than 10 seconds, you are not infected by coronavirus.
Explaination: By holding your breath for 10 seconds, you cannot confirm whether you are infected with coronavirus or not.
Label: False
html:
Claim: If you can hold your breath for more than 10 seconds, you are not infected by coronavirus.

Explanation:By holding your breath for 10 seconds, you cannot confirm whether you are infected with coronavirus or not.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/25/holding-your-breathe-for-10-seconds-is-not-a-valid-test-for-coronavirus/

Claim: Picture of the first new Wuhan coronavirus hospital.
Explaination: This is a stock picture of a modular construction from a Chinese import-export company.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Picture of the first new Wuhan coronavirus hospital.

Explanation:This is a stock picture of a modular construction from a Chinese import-export company.

http://u.afp.com/3okD

Claim: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/its-myth-south-australian-health-authorities-dismiss-rumour-about-ice-rink-turned-morgue-covid-19?check=1

Claim: A 24-hour COVID-19 hotline offers essential food items during curfew in Sri Lanka.
Explaination: Telephone numbers were promoted as means for the public to lodge complaints on those violating government orders or inconveniencing the public during the COVID-19 outbreak, The Numbers have nothing to do with food delivery.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A 24-hour COVID-19 hotline offers essential food items during curfew in Sri Lanka.

Explanation:Telephone numbers were promoted as means for the public to lodge complaints on those violating government orders or inconveniencing the public during the COVID-19 outbreak, The Numbers have nothing to do with food delivery.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/english/fact-check-misleading-message-conveyed-displaying-president-media-contact-numbers/

Claim: Local hospital in Ecuador says first COVID-19 patient didn’t have coronavirus.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: Local hospital in Ecuador says first COVID-19 patient didn’t have coronavirus.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=7

Claim: “The North Carolina and Virginia State line is closed. Nothing in or out.”
Explaination: Some North Carolina local governments have restricted travel. But NC and Virginia have not blocked travel across the border.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “The North Carolina and Virginia State line is closed. Nothing in or out.”

Explanation:Some North Carolina local governments have restricted travel. But NC and Virginia have not blocked travel across the border.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/08/facebook-posts/no-north-carolina-didnt-shut-down-its-borders-prev/

Claim: Kazakhstanis burned and smashed Chinese restaurants and homes because of the spread of coronavirus in the country.
Explaination: The video is real, but the text was misleading. There is no connections between pogroms and coronavirus. It was an ethnic conflict between Kazakhs and Dungans that arose on domestic grounds
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Kazakhstanis burned and smashed Chinese restaurants and homes because of the spread of coronavirus in the country.

Explanation:The video is real, but the text was misleading. There is no connections between pogroms and coronavirus. It was an ethnic conflict between Kazakhs and Dungans that arose on domestic grounds

https://factcheck.kz/en/glavnoe-en/bots-right-wings-and-radicals-how-did-the-fake-news-about-chinese-restaurants-being-burned-in-kazakhstan-spread-on-social-media/

Claim: A photo making the rounds on social media claims to show people who have died from the coronavirus in Italy.
Explaination: The coffins in the photo are those of the victims of the Lampedusa maritime tragedy in 2013.
Label: Partially false
html:
Claim: A photo making the rounds on social media claims to show people who have died from the coronavirus in Italy.

Explanation:The coffins in the photo are those of the victims of the Lampedusa maritime tragedy in 2013.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256128-photo-coffins-people-died-coronavirus-italy

Claim: CDC sponsored Facebook post asking for help with “escaped” coronavirus patient.
Explaination: The post was created by a fake CDC account.
Label: False
html:
Claim: CDC sponsored Facebook post asking for help with “escaped” coronavirus patient.

Explanation:The post was created by a fake CDC account.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471847-fact-check-cdc-sponsored-post-hong-kong-man-quarantine.html

Claim: The Indian Army has been called to control seven areas in Mumbai that are not following the 21 day lockdown and are out of the Mumbai police’s control.
Explaination: The Mumbai police has not called in the army and the seven areas are duly following the lockdown prescribed by the government.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Indian Army has been called to control seven areas in Mumbai that are not following the 21 day lockdown and are out of the Mumbai police’s control.

Explanation:The Mumbai police has not called in the army and the seven areas are duly following the lockdown prescribed by the government.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/false-army-called-in-to-control-seven-areas-in-mumbai-7440

Explaination: Drinking alcohol does not cure coronavirus, alcohol in sanitizers does have an effect.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Drinking alcohol kills the coronavirus.

Explanation:Drinking alcohol does not cure coronavirus, alcohol in sanitizers does have an effect.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/does-drinking-alcohol-prevent-coronavirus-6935

Claim: Indian Army has set-up a 1,000 bed quarantine facility in Rajasthan’s Barmer.
Explaination: The Indian Army clarified that no such facility has been set-up in Rajasthan's Barmer. Also, we found out that the pictures were old and unrelated.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Army has set-up a 1,000 bed quarantine facility in Rajasthan’s Barmer.

Explanation:The Indian Army clarified that no such facility has been set-up in Rajasthan's Barmer. Also, we found out that the pictures were old and unrelated.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/indian-army-set-up-1000-bed-quarantine-facility-in-barmer-fact-check
